item.description: Kinetic thermal energy $$ K_{kin} = \frac{m}{2}v_{th}^2 = \frac{3}{2}kT $$ When an electric field $E$ is applied, each carrier (i.e. electrons and holes) experiences a force $± q \times E$ and is accelerated. These velocities caused by the external electrical field $E$ are called drift velocities 1. The current density $J$, or the current flow of electrons per unit volume, is given by the following: $$ \begin{align*} J_n &= nqv_d \newline J_n &= nq\dfrac{1}{2} \dfrac{q\tau}{m^{2}}E \end{align*} $$
